sections.title: Introduction to Stages
sections.content: Stages are the fundamental building blocks of a chapter in Erainor RPG. A chapter consists of a sequence of stages, each containing text, properties, and possible player choices. This guide provides a deep dive into creating and managing stages using the ERTG Writer GUI.

sections.title: Types of Stages
sections.content:
There are mainly two types of stages: Linear and Input.

1. Linear Stages: These are straightforward and lead the player from one stage to the next.
2. Input Stages: These stages provide the player with input choices and may lead to different paths based on the selected choice.

sections.title: Creating and Editing a Stage
sections.content:
To create or edit a stage, you can use the ERTG Writer GUI's writer view. Here's how:

  1. Select 'New Chapter' or 'Open Chapter' from the main menu.
  2. Use the Stage Editor Panel to create and edit stages.
  3. Choose the stage type, enter the text, and set the properties accordingly.
  4. Save the chapter using 'Save Chapter' under the 'File' menu.

sections.title: Examples of Stages
Special Cases and Choices
sections.content:
Some stages may have special cases and choices that lead to different outcomes. These can be defined in the properties section of the stage. Here's how they work:

Special Case: A special case triggers a specific action if a certain condition is met. For example, in stage 8, if the input name is 'Corrumpere', it leads to a different chapter.

Choices: Choices allow the player to select different paths. In stage 9, the player can choose between 'Male' and 'Female', leading to different chapters based on the choice.
